resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:18461264</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-BAI</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>King's College (Wilkes-Barre, Pa.)</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Ethnic Heritage Studies Program (U.S.)</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Scranton.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>The Study of Ethnic Minorities in Northeastern Pennsylvania: Lackawanna County / Luzerne County. 1974-1975.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contains Ethnic Heritage Studies: Papers of the Institute of King's College, 1975 a 400 page collection of papers presented at a meeting on the ethnic history of northeastern Pennsylvania; an 11 page bibliography of print resources on northeastern Pennsylvania; a 5 page outline of oral history interview topics; a one page topical listing of the contents of oral history interviews; a two page listing of films dealing with the region; a 28 page listing of photographs relating to the region; two descriptive brochures on the Ethnic Studies Institute sponsored through the project; and a four page final report on the project. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Balch Institute for Ethnic Studies Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: The Study of Ethnic Minorities in Northeastern Pennsylvania: Lackawanna County / Luzerne County. 1974-1975.
resource.abstract: Contains Ethnic Heritage Studies: Papers of the Institute of King's College, 1975 a 400 page collection of papers presented at a meeting on the ethnic history of northeastern Pennsylvania; an 11 page bibliography of print resources on northeastern Pennsylvania; a 5 page outline of oral history interview topics; a one page topical listing of the contents of oral history interviews; a two page listing of films dealing with the region; a 28 page listing of photographs relating to the region; two descriptive brochures on the Ethnic Studies Institute sponsored through the project; and a four page final report on the project.
resource.displayEntry: King's College (Wilkes-Barre, Pa.). The Study of Ethnic Minorities in Northeastern Pennsylvania: Lackawanna County / Luzerne County.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:143657135</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-DCU</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Byron, William J., 1927-</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>The William James Byron papers. 1977-1992.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>The collection consists of plaques, awards, medals, diplomas, and regalia dating from Byron's presidencies of the University of Scranton and the Catholic University of America. There are also photographs from his CUA years, especially a 1985 trip to Taiwan. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Catholic University of America</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: The William James Byron papers. 1977-1992.
resource.abstract: The collection consists of plaques, awards, medals, diplomas, and regalia dating from Byron's presidencies of the University of Scranton and the Catholic University of America. There are also photographs from his CUA years, especially a 1985 trip to Taiwan.
resource.displayEntry: Byron, William J., 1927-. The William James Byron papers.

resourceRelations.content: Byron, William J., 1927-. The William James Byron papers.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:721941441</recordOrigin>

                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Correspondence to Chaim Potok, 1983.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Regarding Potok's lecture for the university's Judaic Chair Lecture series with correspondence from coordinator John J. Burns. Includes a program from the lecture and a newspaper clipping. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Pennsylvania Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unitid>MC 558; PhotoCD-4; CD-26; T-290; Vt-151</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <extref>Schlesinger Library, Radcliffe Institute</extref>
                  </repository>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Bernice Resnick Sandler</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <unittitle>Papers of Bernice Resnick Sandler, <unitdate>1963-2008</unitdate>
                  </unittitle>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>28.98 linear ft. </extent>
                     <extent>(69 + 1/2 file boxes) plus 1 folio folder, 2 folio+ folders, 1 oversize folder, 2 supersize folders, 2 audiotapes, 16 videotapes, 1 CD, 5 photograph folders, 1 photoCD, 29 objects, and electronic records</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <langmaterial>Materials in English.</langmaterial>
                  <abstract>Correspondence, writings, testimonies, speeches, subject files, photographs, and audiovisual material of Bernice Resnick Sandler, feminist and activist specializing in  educational equity for women, gender issues in higher education, and other issues of women's rights and equality.</abstract>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Papers of Bernice Resnick Sandler, 1963-2008
resource.abstract: Correspondence, writings, testimonies, speeches, subject files, photographs, and audiovisual material of Bernice Resnick Sandler, feminist and activist specializing in  educational equity for women, gender issues in higher education, and other issues of women's rights and equality.
resource.extent: 28.98 linear ft.; (69 + 1/2 file boxes) plus 1 folio folder, 2 folio+ folders, 1 oversize folder, 2 supersize folders, 2 audiotapes, 16 videotapes, 1 CD, 5 photograph folders, 1 photoCD, 29 objects, and electronic records
